channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: War-oriented countries like Russia and the U. S. avoid a military draft so that citizens don’t become activists. Instead, the U. S. cynically and unfairly relies in part on folks with family traditions of military service. Via @NYTimes. https://t.co/07O9rWDACK
What french fries tell us about America. https://t.co/JHFvcBsB9w

@lisajpetrie On a trip last August, our car's AC broke and we crossed western and northern Iowa with the windows down. From great distances we sniffed approaching CAFOs, which were plentiful. One or two employee cars parked outside each building, a dismal portrait of a once-proud rural life.

Here @nytDavidBrooks traces a psychological progression that many mass shooters may follow. Next question: What is it about our society that sets a substantial number of people, "a steady stream of young men," as he says, on this path? https://t.co/KMrIL4dq10
“A bit depressing to know that I might die before we have clean water in Iowa…” https://t.co/jPuJbvXXGu
Who gets to name your life? https://t.co/8VSR83MTeV

Western writers evaluated and gave names to the actions of Czech people trying to live freer lives, and these names given by others often simplified and obscured parts of the story. Havel suggests this in the opening lines of "The power of the powerless," the essay, not the book.

"We know that in so many of these mass shootings that are now becoming weekly events that the guns are being obtained legally. That should tell all of us that the laws aren't doing their job, if people can't go out to enjoy a 4th of July parade…” https://t.co/xXEppdxkBg

Not quite a week yet, but I asked our regional grocery chain about people carrying guns in the stores--whether or not they have a policy about that. I asked here and by email. No reply either place. https://t.co/3Njtpa8vNt
It's not a painting in the usual sense. It's a set of instructions for a painting. That's how the painter does his work. https://t.co/Z2F9f4EJH0

Building on Drummer features, Andy Sylvester has written an app that demonstrates a topic-focused collaboration & multi-author resource publication built around an opml outline that is able to _include_ other people's opml outlines. https://t.co/iV9zaWzmsz
"People are going to have sex." https://t.co/fLhtWw0fMm
Democratic Party is like Clark Kent if he never goes into the phone booth. https://t.co/C1LqsaCwOo https://t.co/kXUGVWgiRE
What forms of life are native to the U. S. state where you might reside? iNaturalist has a pretty good idea about that. https://t.co/JYW9yfMUP2 https://t.co/YgOb49CjvV
. . . not counting on any latest shiny thing that bobs up in the swirl and churn of tech . . .

A neighbor says, roughly, that having a rape/incest exception means that "The only time you can allow women to make up their own mind about their bodies and their lives is when someone has treated them with great brutality."
